org.micromanager.api

Interface ScriptInterface


  • public interface ScriptInterface
    Interface to execute commands in the main panel. Implemented by MMStudio and available as the gui object in the Beanshell scripting panel. Most functions throw MMScriptException

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • sleep

        void sleep(long ms)
    throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Request a pause in script execution for the specified number of milliseconds. Most systems will guarantee a pause of at least the desired duration, but may wait longer than requested before continuing execution.
        Parameters:
        ms - Time in millisecond that the script should pause
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

        void refreshGUIFromCache()
        Brings GUI up to date with the recent changes in the mmcore. Does not communicate with hardware, only checks Cache

      • snapSingleImage

        void snapSingleImage()
        Snaps image and displays in AcqWindow. Opens a new AcqWindow when current one is not open. Calling this function is the same as pressing the "Snap" button on the main Micro-manager GUI

      • openAcquisition

        void openAcquisition(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String rootDir,
                     int nrFrames,
                     int nrChannels,
                     int nrSlices,
                     int nrPositions,
                     boolean show,
                     boolean save)
              throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Opens a new acquisition data set
        Parameters:
        name - - Name of the data set
        rootDir - - Directory where the new data set is going to be created
        nrFrames - - Number of Frames (time points) in this acquisition
        nrChannels - - Number of Channels in this acquisition
        nrSlices - - Number of Slices (Z-positions) in this acquisition
        nrPositions - Number of (XY) Positions in this acquisition.
        show - Whether or not to show this acquisition.
        save - Whether or not save data during acquisition.
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • createAcquisition

        @Deprecated
java.lang.String createAcquisition(org.json.JSONObject summaryMetadata,
                                               boolean diskCached,
                                               boolean displayOff)
        Deprecated. Use openAcquisition() instead.
        Another way to create data set, an alternative to the openAcquisition(String name, String rootDir, int nrFrames, int nrChannels, int nrSlices, int nrPositions, boolean show, boolean save) The caller is responsible for providing all required metadata within the summaryMetadata argument
        Parameters:
        summaryMetadata - The metadata describing the acquisition parameters
        diskCached - True if images are cached on disk; false if they are kept in RAM only.
        displayOff - True if no display is to be created or shown.
        Returns:

      • initializeAcquisition

        void initializeAcquisition(java.lang.String name,
                           int width,
                           int height,
                           int bytesPerPixel,
                           int bitDepth)
                    throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Set up image physical dimensions for the data set that has already been opened. Once dimensions of the image has been set, they can't be changed, i.e. subsequent calls to this method will generate an error. Typically there is no need to call this method, except when display options have to be set before the first image is inserted. If this method is not explicitly called after openAcquisition(), the image dimensions will be automatically initialized based on the first image inserted in the data set.
        Parameters:
        name - - Name of the data set
        width - - Image width in pixels
        height - - Image height in pixels
        bytesPerPixel - - Number of bytes per pixel
        bitDepth - - Dynamic range in bits per pixel
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • addImageToAcquisition

        void addImageToAcquisition(java.lang.String name,
                           int frame,
                           int channel,
                           int slice,
                           int position,
                           mmcorej.TaggedImage taggedImg)
                    throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Inserts image into the data set.
        Parameters:
        name - - data set name
        frame - - 0 based frame number
        channel - - 0 based channel number
        slice - - 0 based (z) slice number
        position - - 0 based position number
        taggedImg - Tagged Image (image with associated metadata)
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • setAcquisitionAddImageAsynchronous

        void setAcquisitionAddImageAsynchronous(java.lang.String name)
                                 throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Change an acquisition so that adding images to it is done asynchronously. All calls to e.g. addImageToAcquisition() and other similar functions will return nearly-instantly.
        Parameters:
        name - of acquisition
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException - if the specified acquisition does not exist.

      • snapAndAddImage

        void snapAndAddImage(java.lang.String name,
                     int frame,
                     int channel,
                     int z,
                     int position)
              throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Snaps an image with the current settings and places pixels in the specified position of the Micro-Manager Image viewer
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the acquisition.
        frame - Frame number (time point, 0-based) in which this image should be inserted.
        channel - Channel number (0-based) in which this image should be inserted.
        z - Slice number (0-based) in which this image should be inserted.
        position - Position number (0-based) in which this image should be inserted.
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • getAcquisition

        @Deprecated
org.micromanager.acquisition.MMAcquisition getAcquisition(java.lang.String name)
                                                               throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Deprecated. Because it returns an internal object that is subject to change.
        Provides access to the data set through the MMAcquisition interface. Typically there is no need to use this low-level method and interfere with the default acquisition execution. Intended use is within advanced plugins.
        Parameters:
        name - - data set name
        Returns:
        MMAcqusition object
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • getUniqueAcquisitionName

        java.lang.String getUniqueAcquisitionName(java.lang.String stem)
        Returns a name beginning with stem that is not yet used.
        Parameters:
        stem - Base name from which a unique name will be constructed
        Returns:
        a name beginning with stem that is not yet used

      • getCurrentAlbum

        java.lang.String getCurrentAlbum()
        Returns the name of the current album (i.e. the most recently created one) In addition to their use through the scripting interface, Albums are used by the "Camera --> Album" button in the main window of Micro-Manager and the "--> Album" button on the snap/live window
        Returns:
        Name of the current Album.

      • addToAlbum

        void addToAlbum(mmcorej.TaggedImage image)
         throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Add a TaggedImage to an album; creates a new album if the image and current album do not match in image dimensions, bits per pixel, bytes per pixel, or number of channels. The current album is the most recently created one Albums are also used by the "Camera --> Album" button in the main window of Micro-Manager and the "--> Album" button on the snap/live window
        Parameters:
        image - - TaggedImage to be added to album
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • acquisitionExists

        java.lang.Boolean acquisitionExists(java.lang.String name)
        Checks whether an acquisition with the given name already exists.
        Parameters:
        name - name to be tested for existence
        Returns:
        true when name already exists

      • closeAcquisition

        void closeAcquisition(java.lang.String name)
               throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Closes the acquisition. After this command metadata is complete, all the references to this data set are cleaned-up, and no additional images can be added to the acquisition Does not close the window in which the acquisition data is displayed
        Parameters:
        name - name of acquisition to be closed
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • closeAllAcquisitions

        void closeAllAcquisitions()
        Closes all currently open acquisitions.

      • runAcquisition

        java.lang.String runAcquisition()
                         throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Executes Acquisition with current settings Will open the Acquisition Dialog when it is not open yet Returns after Acquisition finishes Note that this function should not be executed on the EDT (which is the thread running the UI).
        Returns:
        The name of the acquisition created.
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • runAcquisition

        java.lang.String runAcquisition(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String root)
                         throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Executes Acquisition with current settings but allows for changing the data path. Will open the Acquisition Dialog when it is not open yet. Returns after Acquisition finishes. Note that this function should not be executed on the EDT (which is the thread running the UI).
        Parameters:
        name - Name of this acquisition.
        root - Place in the file system where data can be stored.
        Returns:
        The name of the acquisition created
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

        channel - - preset for which to change exposure time

        void setChannelContrast(java.lang.String title,
                        int channel,
                        int min,
                        int max)
                 throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Sets min (black) and max (white or the channel's color) pixel value clipping levels for each channel.
        Parameters:
        title - - acquisition name
        channel - - channel index (use 0 if there is only a single channel)
        min - - black clipping level
        max - - white clipping level
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • setContrastBasedOnFrame

                             int frame,
                             int slice)
                      throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

        slice - - slice number

      • versionLessThan

        boolean versionLessThan(java.lang.String version)
                 throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Displays an error message and returns true if the run-time Micro-Manager version is less than the one specified. Versions in Micro-Manager are of the format: major.minor.minute date where ' date' can be omitted Examples: 1.4.6 1.4.6 20110831 When a date is appended to a version number, it will be newer than the same version without a date
        Parameters:
        version - - minimum version needen to run this code
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • setImageSavingFormat

        void setImageSavingFormat(java.lang.Class imageSavingClass)
                   throws org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException
        Set the format for saving images to disk. Images can be written to disk one per a file or multiple images per file. Using multiple images per file should be faster on most systems
        Parameters:
        imageSavingClass - use either org.micromanager.acquisition.TaggedImageStorageDiskDefault.class for single-image files of org.micromanager.acquisition.TaggedImageStorageMultipageTiff.class for multi-image files
        Throws:
        org.micromanager.utils.MMScriptException

      • attachRunnable

        void attachRunnable(int frame,
                    int position,
                    int channel,
                    int slice,
                    java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Attach a runnable to the acquisition engine. Each index (f, p, c, s) can be specified. Passing a value of -1 should result in the runnable being attached at all values of that index. For example, if the first argument is -1, then the runnable should execute at every frame.

      • clearRunnables
